description: Climate data for two localities in East Africa for use in GaiaCatalog. GaiaCatalog is a component in the OHDSI GIS Toolchain
dateCreated: use to specify the date the dataset was initially generated (e.g., when a sensor recorded a value, when a model was run, or when data processing was completed)
dateModified: use to specify the date the dataset was most recently updated or changed
datePublished: use to specify the date when a dataset was made available to the public through a publication process
expires: use to specify the date when the dataset expires and is no longer useful or available
license: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution (CC-BY) 4.0 License

isBasedOn.name: ERA5
isBasedOn.description: ERA5 is the fifth generation ECMWF reanalysis for the global climate and weather for the past 8 decades. Data is available from 1940 onwards. ERA5 replaces the ERA-Interim reanalysis.

appearance.headline: Effect of climate change on the HIV response
appearance.text: Climate change [through a series of intervening variables] may increase the rates of HIV infection and worsen the health and wellbeing of people with HIV. Impacts on HIV programmes and people with HIV can manifest as reduced access to prevention, testing, and treatment services, poor adherence to treatment, poor nutrition,and reduced immunity.

firstAppearance.creditText: Lieber M, Chin-Hong P, Whittle HJ, Hogg R, Weiser SD
firstAppearance.headline: The Synergistic Relationship Between Climate Change and the HIV/AIDS Epidemic: A Conceptual Framework
firstAppearance.text: Four pathways linking climate change with HIV/AIDS are summarized in Fig. 1. This model is based on an in-depth literature review of the interaction between climate change, food insecurity, infectious diseases, human migration, destruction of healthcare infrastructure, and HIV/AIDS performed between June 6 and June 27, 2019.

spatialCoverage.name: Magu
spatialCoverage.description: We used the geocoordinates of the centroid of the Magu HDSS and applied a buffer around it consistent with the geography of the area
spatialCoverage.disambiguatingDescription: This buffer helped account for potential inaccuracies in the centroid coordinates and the limited resolution of the climate data

geo.circle: A circle is the circular region of a specified radius centered at a specified latitude and longitude. A circle is expressed as a pair followed by a radius in meters.

spatialCoverage.name: Nairobi
spatialCoverage.description: We used the geocoordinates of the centroid of the Nairobi HDSS and applied a buffer around it consistent with the geography of the area
spatialCoverage.disambiguatingDescription: This buffer helped account for potential inaccuracies in the centroid coordinates and the limited resolution of the climate data

geo.circle: A circle is the circular region of a specified radius centered at a specified latitude and longitude. A circle is expressed as a pair followed by a radius in meters.

spatialCoverage.name: Magu care site
spatialCoverage.description: Main care site for HIV care in the Magu district
spatialCoverage.disambiguatingDescription: Used in conjunction with the place of residence to determine distance to care

spatialCoverage.name: Nairobi care site
spatialCoverage.description: Main care site for HIV care in the Nairobi district
spatialCoverage.disambiguatingDescription: Used in conjunction with the place of residence to determine distance to care

temporal: It may be we will want to support two or more temporal resolutions, depending upon the patterns that they surface. Two are specified in temporalCoverage. The first is the monthly average (P1M) beginning in 1994 every year for 20 years (R20). temporalCoverge is a shorthand for temporal using ISO 8601. See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601

measurementTechnique.description: Using the ERA5 Climate Reanalysis of Copernicus satellite data, hourly climate data for the Magu and Nairobi HDSS sites is aggregated monthly across the temporal coverage. Additional variables based on the Copernicus ERA5 satellite are also calculated

distribution.description: Includes maximum temperature, minimum temperature, precipitation and relative humidity aggregated monthly
distribution.disambiguatingDescription: Also includes exceedance probabilities for drought and flooding and a derived variable called heat stress at the Magu and Nairobi locations

potentialAction.description: Includes maximum temperature, minimum temperature, precipitation and relative humidity aggregated monthly
potentialAction.disambiguatingDescription: Also includes exceedance probabilities for drought and flooding and a derived variable called heat stress at the Magu and Nairobi locations

target.description: Downloads a dataset based, for example, on the requested format, start/end dates and bounding box. Actual request and query parameters to be determined with Tim N

query-input.description: The desired format requested either 'application/x-netcdf' or 'text/tab-separated-values'
Two points in decimal degrees that create a bounding box fomatted at 'lon,lat' of the lower-left corner and 'lon,lat' of the upper-right

provider.legalName: African Population and Health Research Center
provider.name: APHRC

variableMeasured.name: A unit data variable name. Required
variableMeasured.description: A unit data variable description. Required
variableMeasured.propertyID: A URL for the unit data concept within a vocabulary. Required
variableMeasured.measurementMethod: A detailed description of the measurement technique. Can be an enumeration. Optional
variableMeasured.measurementTechnique: A high level description of the measurement technique, Can be a URL. Required
variableMeasured.unitCode: Either text or a URL that goes to a concept in a unit of measurement vocab like qudt and ucum. Always needed when the datatype is a number. Conditionally required
variableMeasured.unitText: Used to decypher a unitCode. Conditionally required
variableMeasured.minValue: The lower value of some characteristic or property. Optional
variableMeasured.maxValue: The upper value of some characteristic or property. Optional

valueReference.name: analysisRole
valueReference.description: Planned use of variable downstream during analysis

variableMeasured.name: monthly average of daily maximum temperature
measurementTechnique: Step 2: Add up all the daily maximum temperatures you collected in the previous step.
Step 3: Count the number of days in that month.
Step 4: Calculate the average by dividing the sum from Step 2 by the number of days from Step 3.

measurementQualifier.marginOfError: a human readable statement of the value margin of error
measurementQualifier.maxValue: the highest (recordable) value of an observation
measurementQualifier.minValue: the lowest (recordable) value of an observation

extendedConstraintProperty.name: timePeriod
extendedConstraintProperty.description: The timePeriod is specified in ISO 8601 format. It has a start date, an interval and an argument (Rn) that repeats the interval beginning at the start date
value: The value is a time series that begins Jan 2014 and repeats each month thereafter for the next 120 months

valueReference.name: ConstraintPropertyType
valueReference.description: The ConstraintProperty type has one of two values -- 'dimension' or 'attribute'. Types take after SDMX and RDF Data Cube dimensions and attributes
valueReference.disambiguatingDescription: Attributes give context to the underlying measure. A dimension breaks out a measure into a controlled vocabulary of one or more categories

extendedConstraintProperty.description: A human readable description of geographicalArea

value.disambiguatingDescription: This buffer helped account for potential inaccuracies in the centroid coordinates and the limited resolution of the climate data.
value.circle: A circle is the circular region of a specified radius centered at a specified latitude and longitude. A circle is expressed as a pair followed by a radius in meters.

valueReference.name: ConstraintPropertyType
valueReference.description: The ConstraintProperty type has one of two values -- 'dimension' or 'attribute'. Types take after SDMX and RDF Data Cube dimensions and attributes
valueReference.disambiguatingDescription: Attributes give context to the underlying measure. A dimension breaks out a measure into a controlled vocabulary of one or more categories

variableMeasured.name: 10% exceedance probability of flood
variableMeasured.description: We approximate the 10% exceedance probability threshold using unrouted daily runoff for each calendar month and each gridded cell
variableMeasured.disambiguatingDescription: An exceedance probability developed from a population of daily runoff in a given month should not be confused with annual flood statistics, which are developed by fitting a statistical distribution to a population of annual maximum daily streamflow
measurementTechnique: Extract monthly maximum flows from the long-term, routed streamflow time series
One standard for 'long term' is 10 years
Routed streamflow is derived from the VIC (Variable Infiltation Capacity) model
For each month of the routed streamflow time series, sort the maximum monthly flow values in descending order, from largest to smallest
Calculate the empirical exceedance probability using the Weibull formula

measurementQualifier.description: The 10% exceedance probability of flood statistic is built on top of the streamflow time series
measurementQualifier.marginOfError: A human readable statement of the value margin of error. In this use case there is no ground truth at first which adds to the margin of error. The plan is to add ground meteorological data alongside the satellite data as VIC inputs

description: The streamflow time series is derived from VIC coupled with a separate hydrological routing model
Together they specify how the runoff travels through the river network to a specific point of interest
measurementQualifier.marginOfError: A human readable statement of the value margin of error. In this use case there is no ground truth at first which adds to the margin of error. The plan is to add ground meteorological data alongside the satellite data as VIC inputs

additionalType: Annual Exceedance Probability of a 24-hour flood event
Recurrence Interval of a 24-hour flood event

potentialAction.name: Aggregation
potentialAction.description: Aggregation creates Magu and Nairobi monthly maximum temperature, minimum temperature, precipitation and relative humidity variables from ERA5 hourly data

object.name: ERA5
object.description: ERA5 is the fifth generation ECMWF reanalysis for the global climate and weather for the past 8 decades. Data is available from 1940 onwards. ERA5 replaces the ERA-Interim reanalysis.
object.conditionsOfAccess: Conditions that affect the availability of, or method(s) of access to, an item.

spatialCoverage.description: ERA5 reanalysis covers the entire globe with a horizontal resolution of 0.25° x 0.25° (approximately 31km). It also has 137 vertical levels, reaching from the surface up to a height of 80km.

instrument.permissions: Permission(s) required to run the app
